logic.simulator
Class SimulationResult

java.lang.Object
  logic.simulator.SimulationResult
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SimulationResult
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Collects all the information of a performed simulation. This class takes a set of hands instead of a list to make it more effective.

See Also:

resultForHand

private java.util.Map<AbstractStartingHand,int[]> resultForHand
Map containing the results for each of the starting hands. The value is an integer array with the same size as the set of the starting hands. The number that is in index 0 of the array are the number of times the hand won in a one-way tie, i.e. the times the hand won outright. The number that is saved in index 1 is the number of times the hand won in a two-way tie, the index 2 the number it won in a three-way tie and so on. The data for different ties is needed when the expected value for the hand is calculated.

Constructor Detail

SimulationResult

public SimulationResult(java.util.Set<AbstractStartingHand> startingHands,
                        FiveCardBoard board,
                        int numberOfSimulations,
                        PokerGameType gameType)
Creates a new SimulationResult for a game with board cards. For games without board cards, use the other constructor.

Parameters:
startingHands - Set of starting hands
board - The board
numberOfSimulations - Number of performed simulations
gameType - Poker game type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the objects are null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfSimulations isn't positive
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are fewer than two starting hands.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the gameType isn't a community card game.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the hands don't have the game type given in the constructor

addResultForOneSimulation

public void addResultForOneSimulation(java.util.Set<AbstractStartingHand> winners)
Adds a result of one simulation. This method is synchronized to enable parallel simulations using threads.

Parameters:
winners - Set containing the winning starting hands.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the winning hands aren't in the set of starting hands.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if winners is null or empty.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if enough simulations have been performed, i.e. the number of performed simulations is already at the maximum number given in the constructor.

getStartingHands

public java.util.Set<AbstractStartingHand> getStartingHands()
Returns a copy of the set of starting hands.

Returns:
Set of starting hands.

getWinPercentageForHand

public double getWinPercentageForHand(AbstractStartingHand hand,
                                      int numberOfSignificantDigits)
Retrieves the win percentage for a hand.

Parameters:
hand - Starting hand
numberOfSignificantDigits - Accuracy of the returned double
Returns:
Winning probability in percent.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the hand is null or isn't contained in the set of starting hands of the simulation result.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if enough simulations haven't been performed yet.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfSignificantDigits isn't positive.

getTiePercentageForHand

public double getTiePercentageForHand(AbstractStartingHand hand,
                                      int numberOfSignificantDigits)
Retrieves the tie percentage for a hand. All types of ties are included here. Different types of ties are used to calculate the expected value.

Parameters:
hand - Starting hand
numberOfSignificantDigits - Accuracy of the returned double
Returns:
Tying probability in percent.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the hand is null or isn't contained in the set of starting hands of the simulation result.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if enough simulations haven't been performed yet.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfSignificantDigits isn't positive.

getEquityForHand

Retrieves the equity for a hand. The equity is given as a number between 0 and 1, not as a percentage.
